# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is a function that wraps text to a specified text width:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    line = ""
    lines = String[]
    
    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, line)
            line = ""
        end
        if isempty(line)
            line = word
        else
            line = line * " " * word  
        end
    end
    push!(lines, line)
    
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed mollis velit sit amet mauris."

print(wrap_string(text)) 
```

This iterates through the words, keeping a `line` string. Each time adding a word would exceed the text width, it starts a new line. The lines are collected in the `lines` array. Finally it joins the lines with newline characters and returns.

With the default 10 character width, the wrapped string would be:

```
Lorem ipsum
dolor sit
amet,
consectetur
adipiscing
elit. Sed
mollis velit
sit amet
mauris.
```
